title: cygan
author: cygan
content: Hannes Graah is the former vice president of growth at Revolut. he left the company in 2022 and began building his own platform called Zeal. HG has assembled a team of 11 former employees from Revolut, Spotify and the Coinbase exchange to create an innovative cryptocurrency wallet. the team has announced that the wallet will launch as early as q1/2024. will Zeal be good enough to compete with other cryptocurrency wallets currently on the market?the main goal of the Zeal platform is to solve problems such as lack of security, poor user experience and transaction fees. the project aims to be a digital cryptocurrency wallet with advanced security controls and free bank transfers. according to the press release, Zeal wants to set new standards in the wallet user experience when managing cryptocurrencies, using web3 applications and decentralized finance (dapps).https://www.theblock.co/post/263969/former-revolut-employees-launch-new-crypto-wallet-called-zeal

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Before it can b discussed if it will be a competitor to other digital wallets, we need to see more details about the wallet and how exactly it will functon and then it has to actually function as promised without lag or other issues.Quote from: cygan on November 21, 2023, 06:48:23 PMthe project aims to be a digital cryptocurrency wallet with advanced security controls and free bank transfers. I will like to see how the wallet will pull off bank transfers and decentralized, or if it will encourage self custody.

comments.author: Yamane_Keto
comments.body: Quote from: cygan on November 21, 2023, 06:48:23 PMthe main goal of the Zeal platform is to solve problems such as lack of security, poor user experience and transaction fees. the project aims to be a digital cryptocurrency wallet with advanced security controls and free bank transfers. according to the press release, Zeal wants to set new standards in the wallet user experience when managing cryptocurrencies, using web3 applications and decentralized finance (dapps).this is more like to crypto exchange than crypto wallet. I don't think it will be open source or will encourage self-custody, so it may be a competitor to the trust wallet or a new type of wallet that will meet regulatory requirements. The problem with such wallets is that they will focus on accepting more tokens and adding traditional verification methods such as 2FA, which will be very bad for privacy and more likely to be hacked.

comments.author: satscraper
comments.created_time: November 22, 2023, 08:30:48 AMLast edit: November 22, 2023, 10:42:13 AM by satscraper
comments.body: I would never trust any wallet which don't has at least two years of history in user experience. Former Revolut employees have never been involved into software&hardware-wallets design so I would even extend (up to  5 years) this "precaution"  period for their might-be wallet,  you can't be too careful. To build wallet from scratch is nothing to sneeze at.

comments.author: bayu7adi
comments.body: Quote from: Yamane_Keto on November 22, 2023, 06:11:18 AMthis is more like to crypto exchange than crypto wallet. I don't think it will be open source or will encourage self-custody, so it may be a competitor to the trust wallet or a new type of wallet that will meet regulatory requirements. The problem with such wallets is that they will focus on accepting more tokens and adding traditional verification methods such as 2FA, which will be very bad for privacy and more likely to be hacked.I actually see this as a kind of mix between MetaMask and TrustWallet, but with more features like free transaction fees to bank transfers.QuoteYou can use Zeal Wallet anywhere that you can use Metamask. Here’s how to connect to websites/applications using ZealQuoted from https://docs.zeal.app/getting-started-with-zeal/connecting-to-websitesAccording to what I read there, it seems like Zeal is trying to outshine MetaMask and snatch its users. It's highly likely they're targeting the altcoin user market, as that's what both MetaMask and TrustWallet have been doing. Even though this wallet can store BTC, I'm a bit skeptical about BTC users keeping their assets here.

comments.author: ABCbits
comments.body: Quote from: cygan on November 21, 2023, 06:48:23 PMhttps://www.theblock.co/post/263969/former-revolut-employees-launch-new-crypto-wallet-called-zealThis news doesn't mention anything about open source or transparency. So this wallet is likely to be closed-source and possibility being custodial wallet/service which doesn't interest me and many reader in this forum.Quote from: https://www.theblock.co/post/263969/former-revolut-employees-launch-new-crypto-wallet-called-zealZeal hopes to solve issues related to scams and hacks with a wallet that the company said "solves the security problem with advanced security checks and previews for web3 transactions that keep people safe from scams."I don't know about how their security check works, but transaction preview already available on many wallet.

comments.author: shield132
comments.body: Quote from: cygan on November 21, 2023, 06:48:23 PMHannes Graah is the former vice president of growth at Revolut. he left the company in 2022 and began building his own platform called Zeal. HG has assembled a team of 11 former employees from Revolut, Spotify and the Coinbase exchange to create an innovative cryptocurrency wallet.This is already bullshit. Former employees of Revolut, Spotify and Coinbase (three of them centralized platforms that aim to become the central power of their industries) are never going to create a honest, decentralized wallet that will be the competitor of Electrum and Sparrw.Quote from: cygan on November 21, 2023, 06:48:23 PMthe main goal of the Zeal platform is to solve problems such as lack of security, poor user experience and transaction fees. the project aims to be a digital cryptocurrency wallet with advanced security controls and free bank transfers. according to the press release, Zeal wants to set new standards in the wallet user experience when managing cryptocurrencies, using web3 applications and decentralized finance (dapps).I read this part right now, guess what? The above is truth. They are going to create competitor of blockchain.com wallet but no one should use them because digital bitcoin wallets are not secure and destroy the core principles of bitcoin. There is no difference between using a centralized exchange and digital bitcoin wallet, they both have the ownership of your coins. It's better to use Electrum and Sparrow, both tried and tested multiple times, they are the best choice right now next to Hardware wallets. If I learnt anything from 2016, it's that 3rd party platforms should never be used if someone prioritizes privacy and security of their assets.

comments.author: aylabadia05
comments.body: From the zeal.app site, I think this wallet is more focused on crypto swaps.More information about this wallet, it seems to be something like metamask. Due to its planned launch in 2024, we will wait to see how Zeal is rumored to be a solution amidst security concerns in the digital currency environment[1]. If in the end Zeal is the same as TrustWallet or other closed source wallets, it means that Zeal is not a solution for the security in question.[1] https://www.investing.com/news/cryptocurrency-news/zeal-digital-wallet-set-to-transform-crypto-and-web3-transactions-93CH-3240455

comments.author: joniboini
comments.body: Quote from: aylabadia05 on November 22, 2023, 12:31:46 PMDue to its planned launch in 2024, we will wait to see how Zeal is rumored to be a solution amidst security concerns in the digital currency environment[1]. If in the end Zeal is the same as TrustWallet or other closed source wallets, it means that Zeal is not a solution for the security in question.They don't offer anything new. From what they said, their new offer is. basically a phishing/scam list check if I get it correcly. Not really groundbreaking since most of them are available in many apps today. Other than probably a better blocking list, or the so-called advanced AI-powered list, I don't see how it will be different compared to what we have today. Even if they offer something new, it will likely be a closed source as mentioned above. CMIIW.

comments.author: pooya87
comments.body: Although we need to first see this released before we can judge it but with the available information I wouldn't even categorize it as a "cryptocurrency wallet". It is more like a centralized service where you create an "account" and give up all control over your own money to this company that just popped up out of nowhere and trust them with it.So if anything it should be compared with its counterparts such as coinbase accounts or centralized exchange accounts!

comments.author: PrivacyG
comments.body: Quote from: cygan on November 21, 2023, 06:48:23 PMthe main goal of the Zeal platform is to solve problems such as lack of security, poor user experience and transaction fees.I wonder how they will solve Transaction Fees in a way that does not interrupt Decentralization.  By interrupting Decentralization, it is pointless to use Zeal and think it is safe.  Defeats the purpose of holding and using Bitcoin.Unless they create a Second Layer or make use of Lightning Network.  But I doubt that is the case.Every time I see 'Crypto Wallet' next to 'Banks' I raise a big red flag and one more of disinterest.  I am not using Cryptocurrency to then transfer it to Banks.  I use Cryptocurrency to NOT use Banks any more.

comments.author: Husires
comments.body: I see they announced that the cryptography libraries will be available as open source and that they will have all the features of current wallets with a friendly UI. Many people may not like it here, but if they provide a simple UI and a highly organized service for exchanging between cryptocurrencies to the bank account within the wallet, they may get a lot of downloads.Some simple features like this may help beginners to avoid losing their investments.

comments.author: pooya87
comments.body: Quote from: Husires on November 24, 2023, 10:53:32 AMI see they announced that the cryptography libraries will be available as open sourceGenerally speaking this is what shady wallets do. They open source "part" of their tool to look open source and less shady. For example libraries, the UI (front-end), etc. but the actual project is never open source which is the only thing that matters. Otherwise libraries are always open source specially cryptography ones like libsec256k1, they aren't doing anything special by using them!
